sources.title: The Hole
sources.description: This award winning animation accompanies improvised dialogue between Dizzy Gillespie and George Matthews, who play construction workers having a conversation during work. Their conversation turns to the threat of nuclear disaster and the potential for that to be cause by a technical mistake. This film won the 1962 Academy Award for Best Short Subject (Cartoon)

metadata.Plot: Two men discuss the nature of accidents and the possibility of nuclear war.
